SEARCH
Package database

Class Column

java.lang.Object
database.Column
public class Column extends Object
Represents a column in a database table, containing multiple cells and having a specific data type.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Column()
    Constructs a new Column with the default type of STRING and initializes cells.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    editColumnType(ColumnType type)
    Changes the data type of the column and updates existing cells accordingly.
    boolean
    getAllowBlank()
    Checks whether blank values are allowed in this column.
    ArrayList<Cell>
    getCells()
    Retrieves all cells stored in this column.
    String
    getDefaultValue()
    Retrieves the default value of this column.
    ColumnType
    getType()
    Gets the type of data stored in this column.
    void
    registerCell(Cell cell)
    Registers a cell to this column.
    void
    resetDefaultValue()
    Resets the default value of the column based on its type and whether blank values are allowed.
    void
    setAllowBlank(boolean allowBlank)
    Sets whether blank values are allowed in this column.
    void
    setDefaultValue(String defaultValue)
    Sets the default value for this column.
    void
    toggleColumnType()
    Cycles through the different column types in the order: STRING -> INTEGER -> BOOLEAN -> EMAIL -> STRING.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Column

      public Column()
      Constructs a new Column with the default type of STRING and initializes cells.

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public ColumnType getType()
      Gets the type of data stored in this column.
      Returns:
      the current ColumnType of this column.

    • registerCell

      public void registerCell(Cell cell)
      Registers a cell to this column.
      Parameters:
      cell - the Cell object to be added to the column.

    • getAllowBlank

      public boolean getAllowBlank()
      Checks whether blank values are allowed in this column.
      Returns:
      true if blank values are allowed, false otherwise.

    • editColumnType

      public void editColumnType(ColumnType type)
      Changes the data type of the column and updates existing cells accordingly.
      Parameters:
      type - the new ColumnType to set.

    • setAllowBlank

      public void setAllowBlank(boolean allowBlank)
      Sets whether blank values are allowed in this column.
      Parameters:
      allowBlank - true to allow blank values, false otherwise.

    • getCells

      public ArrayList<Cell> getCells()
      Retrieves all cells stored in this column.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Cell objects contained in the column.

    • resetDefaultValue

      public void resetDefaultValue()
      Resets the default value of the column based on its type and whether blank values are allowed.

    • setDefaultValue

      public void setDefaultValue(String defaultValue)
      Sets the default value for this column.
      Parameters:
      defaultValue - the default value to be set.

    • getDefaultValue

      public String getDefaultValue()
      Retrieves the default value of this column.
      Returns:
      the current default value as a String.

    • toggleColumnType

      public void toggleColumnType()
      Cycles through the different column types in the order: STRING -> INTEGER -> BOOLEAN -> EMAIL -> STRING.
